title: Cartomancer
data:
The **Cartomancer** is a role that appears in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"). Cartomancers are spellcasters with a focus on using scrolls and summoning temporary minions to do their bidding. Many parts of the role are inspired by or pay homage to various trading card games.

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ ]## Contents* [1 Starting inventory](#Starting_inventory)

* [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)

* [3 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)

* [4 Gods](#Gods)

* [5 Skills](#Skills)

* [6 Techniques](#Techniques)

* [7 Special rules](#Special_rules)

  - [7.1 Cartomancer names for items](#Cartomancer_names_for_items)
  - [7.2 Scroll rarity](#Scroll_rarity)
  - [7.3 Create specific monster](#Create_specific_monster)
  - [7.4 Writing scrolls](#Writing_scrolls)

* [8 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [8.1 Conducts](#Conducts)
  - [8.2 Early game](#Early_game)
  - [8.3 Late game](#Late_game)

* [9 Quest](#Quest) |

## Starting inventory

Each Cartomancer starts with the following:

- A [Hawaiian shirt](/wiki/Hawaiian_shirt "Hawaiian shirt")
- A +1 [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")
- 60 [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")
- 4 random blessed [scrolls](/wiki/Scrolls "Scrolls")
- 3 [scrolls of create monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_create_monster "Scroll of create monster")

## Intrinsics

Cartomancers gain intrinsics at these [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- Level 1: [Searching](/wiki/Searching "Searching")
- Level 7: [Warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning")

## Rank titles

- XL 1-2 Learner
- XL 3-5 Shuffler
- XL 6-9 Player
- XL 10-13 Reader
- XL 14-17 Strategist
- XL 18-21 Deck Stacker
- XL 22-25 Card Collector
- XL 26-29 Deck Stacker
- XL 30 King/Queen of Games

## Gods

- Lawful: Johnny
- Neutral: Spike
- Chaotic: Timmy

## Skills

| **Max** | **Skill**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Basic   | - *Weapons:* [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident")
- *Combat:* [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding")
- *Magic:* [healing](/wiki/Healing "Healing")
- *Other:* [cooking](/wiki/Cooking "Cooking") |
| Skilled | * *Weapons:* [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling"), [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")
* *Magic:* [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment_spells "Enchantment spells"), [clerical](/wiki/Clerical "Clerical")                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Expert  | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")
- *Magic:* [attack](/wiki/Attack_spells "Attack spells"), [divination](/wiki/Divination "Divination"), [escape](/wiki/Escape "Escape"), [matter](/wiki/Matter "Matter")                                                                                                                                                        |

## Techniques

Cartomancers can make use of the following techniques:

- Level 1: **Soul of the cards**: This technique polymorphs the first scroll in the player's inventory and immediately reads it. If the player is in trouble, then the scroll will be a type that can help them, otherwise the type of scroll is random.
- Level 5: **Card combo**: This technique lets the player immediately read several scrolls in the same turn.
- Level 15: **Card capture**: This technique transforms a targeted monster into a scroll of create monster, keyed to that monster.

## Special rules

### Cartomancer names for items

Since Cartomancers are a reference to *Yu-Gi-Oh* and other trading card games, several of their items have been renamed accordingly.

| Item name                                                     | Cartomancer item name |
| ------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------- |
| [large box](/wiki/Large_box "Large box")                      | *deck box*            |
| [lock pick](/wiki/Lock_pick "Lock pick")                      | *worthless card*      |
| [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")                         | *razor card*          |
| [Hawaiian shirt](/wiki/Hawaiian_shirt "Hawaiian shirt")       | *graphic tee*         |
| [expensive camera](/wiki/Expensive_camera "Expensive camera") | *holographic card*    |
| [credit card](/wiki/Credit_card "Credit card")                | *banned card*         |
| [gold piece](/wiki/Gold_piece "Gold piece")                   | *victory token*       |
| [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack")                                     | *card bag*            |

### Scroll rarity

When playing a Cartomancer, all scrolls are referred to with a rarity. This rarity does not refer to how often the item is generated, but instead to the base price of the item. This system functions as a limited form of [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification").

| **Cost** | **Rarity** |
| -------- | ---------- |
| 0–59     | common     |
| 60–99    | uncommon   |
| 100–199  | rare       |
| 200–299  | super rare |
| ≥ 300    | legendary  |

### Create specific monster

When playing a Cartomancer, every time a creature leaves a corpse, there is a 1⁄2 chance that a scroll of create monster is dropped instead. Such scrolls are keyed to the type of the monster that was killed. Reading the scroll will create a tame version of that monster, which will serve the Cartomancer for between 15 and (4 × XL) turns. When these turns have elapsed, the creature vanishes in a puff of smoke.

Other roles can obtain these special scrolls via [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones"), although the creature will only remain for 5 to 10 turns, and reading a cursed scroll will always create a hostile version of the monster instead of a tame one.

### Writing scrolls

Writing scrolls as a Cartomancer is considered forgery, and as such carries a hefty penalty to [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record").

## Strategy

### Conducts

Due to encountering corpses less often and starting with no food, Cartomancers might as well attempt the [foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless") or related [conducts](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"). [Illiterate](/wiki/Illiterate "Illiterate"), on the other hand, would take away everything that the role normally provides.

### Early game

Cartomancers are arguably the hardest role in SpliceHack, in large part due to the difficulty of living past the early game. Like Tourists, they start with little to no combat ability and no spellbooks. Unlike Tourists, however, Cartomancers lack a reliable source of food. Many of the monsters that can be tamed are not very useful, and as such survival is a struggle. Players should prioritize finding a reliable food source, a decent weapon, and some spellbooks.

### Late game

Cartomancers excel in the late game. There is ample access to scrolls of create monster, and the player can take advantage of the Cartomancer's powerful spellcasting skills.

## Quest

The Cartomancer quest sees the player fighting [Dal Zethire](/wiki/Dal_Zethire "Dal Zethire") in an attempt to obtain [the Holographic Void Lily](/wiki/The_Holographic_Void_Lily "The Holographic Void Lily").
html:
Cartomancer

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Cartomancer is a role that appears in SpliceHack. Cartomancers are spellcasters with a focus on using scrolls and summoning temporary minions to do their bidding. Many parts of the role are inspired by or pay homage to various trading card games.

Contents

  • 1 Starting inventory
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Rank titles
  • 4 Gods
  • 5 Skills
  • 6 Techniques
  • 7 Special rules
    • 7.1 Cartomancer names for items
    • 7.2 Scroll rarity
    • 7.3 Create specific monster
    • 7.4 Writing scrolls
  • 8 Strategy
    • 8.1 Conducts
    • 8.2 Early game
    • 8.3 Late game
  • 9 Quest

Starting inventory

Each Cartomancer starts with the following:

  • A Hawaiian shirt
  • A +1 dagger
  • 60 shuriken
  • 4 random blessed scrolls
  • 3 scrolls of create monster

Intrinsics

Cartomancers gain intrinsics at these experience levels:

  • Level 1: Searching
  • Level 7: Warning

Rank titles

  • XL 1-2 Learner
  • XL 3-5 Shuffler
  • XL 6-9 Player
  • XL 10-13 Reader
  • XL 14-17 Strategist
  • XL 18-21 Deck Stacker
  • XL 22-25 Card Collector
  • XL 26-29 Deck Stacker
  • XL 30 King/Queen of Games

Gods

  • Lawful: Johnny
  • Neutral: Spike
  • Chaotic: Timmy

Skills

Max Skill
Basic
  • Weapons: axe, short sword, club, mace, quarterstaff, polearms, spear, trident
  • Combat: riding
  • Magic: healing
  • Other: cooking
Skilled
  • Weapons: knife, sling, bare hands
  • Magic: enchantment, clerical
Expert
  • Weapons: dagger, dart, shuriken
  • Magic: attack, divination, escape, matter

Techniques

Cartomancers can make use of the following techniques:

  • Level 1: Soul of the cards: This technique polymorphs the first scroll in the player's inventory and immediately reads it. If the player is in trouble, then the scroll will be a type that can help them, otherwise the type of scroll is random.
  • Level 5: Card combo: This technique lets the player immediately read several scrolls in the same turn.
  • Level 15: Card capture: This technique transforms a targeted monster into a scroll of create monster, keyed to that monster.

Special rules

Cartomancer names for items

Since Cartomancers are a reference to Yu-Gi-Oh and other trading card games, several of their items have been renamed accordingly.

Item name Cartomancer item name
large box deck box
lock pick worthless card
shuriken razor card
Hawaiian shirt graphic tee
expensive camera holographic card
credit card banned card
gold piece victory token
sack card bag

Scroll rarity

When playing a Cartomancer, all scrolls are referred to with a rarity. This rarity does not refer to how often the item is generated, but instead to the base price of the item. This system functions as a limited form of price identification.

Cost Rarity
0–59 common
60–99 uncommon
100–199 rare
200–299 super rare
≥ 300 legendary

Create specific monster

When playing a Cartomancer, every time a creature leaves a corpse, there is a 1⁄2 chance that a scroll of create monster is dropped instead. Such scrolls are keyed to the type of the monster that was killed. Reading the scroll will create a tame version of that monster, which will serve the Cartomancer for between 15 and (4 × XL) turns. When these turns have elapsed, the creature vanishes in a puff of smoke.

Other roles can obtain these special scrolls via bones, although the creature will only remain for 5 to 10 turns, and reading a cursed scroll will always create a hostile version of the monster instead of a tame one.

Writing scrolls

Writing scrolls as a Cartomancer is considered forgery, and as such carries a hefty penalty to alignment record.

Strategy

Conducts

Due to encountering corpses less often and starting with no food, Cartomancers might as well attempt the foodless or related conducts. Illiterate, on the other hand, would take away everything that the role normally provides.

Early game

Cartomancers are arguably the hardest role in SpliceHack, in large part due to the difficulty of living past the early game. Like Tourists, they start with little to no combat ability and no spellbooks. Unlike Tourists, however, Cartomancers lack a reliable source of food. Many of the monsters that can be tamed are not very useful, and as such survival is a struggle. Players should prioritize finding a reliable food source, a decent weapon, and some spellbooks.

Late game

Cartomancers excel in the late game. There is ample access to scrolls of create monster, and the player can take advantage of the Cartomancer's powerful spellcasting skills.

Quest

The Cartomancer quest sees the player fighting Dal Zethire in an attempt to obtain the Holographic Void Lily.

'''Rarity''' |- | 0–59 || common |- | 60–99 || uncommon |- | 100–199 || rare |- | 200–299 || super rare |- | ≥ 300 || legendary |- |} === Create specific monster === When playing a Cartomancer, every time a creature leaves a corpse, there is a {{frac|2}} chance that a scroll of create monster is dropped instead. [[Illiterate]], on the other hand, would take away everything that the role normally provides. === Early game === Cartomancers are arguably the hardest role in SpliceHack, in large part due to the difficulty of living past the early game. Like Tourists, they start with little to no combat ability and no spellbooks. Unlike Tourists, however, Cartomancers lack a reliable source of food. Many of the monsters that can be tamed are not very useful, and as such survival is a struggle. There is ample access to scrolls of create monster, and the player can take advantage of the Cartomancer's powerful spellcasting skills. == Quest == The Cartomancer quest sees the player fighting [[Dal Zethire]] in an attempt to obtain [[the Holographic Void Lily]].
